summary: Millions of Americans lost jobs and employer-sponsored health insurance during the COVID-19 pandemic. Short-term insurance was one option for them. We found that there hasn't been enough data collected about short-term plans to understand the role they played during the pandemic. Short-term plans, which may feature lower premiums, generally are not subject to federal health insurance requirements, such as pre-existing condition coverage. Some stakeholders said...
title: Private Health Insurance: Limited Data Hinders Understanding of Short-Term Plans' Role and Value During the COVID-19 Pandemic
